article.description: Tim Duncan had 26 points and 12 rebounds as the Spurs extended their winning streak to nine games with a 97-79 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers on Wednesday night.
article.headline: At 19-4, Spurs off to best start in club history

images.name: Daniels, Antonio 011219 inline
images.caption: Spurs guard Antonio Daniels dunks against Portland's' Ruben Boumtje-Boumtje.

article.linkText: Sizzling Spurs rip Blazers for ninth straight win
article.story:
SAN ANTONIO (AP) -- Tim Duncan and the San Antonio Spurs are making it difficult for the Los Angeles Lakers to open a big lead in the Western Conference. Duncan had 26 points and 12 rebounds as the Spurs extended their winning streak to nine games with a 97-79 victory over the Portland Trail Blazers on Wednesday night. The Spurs are off to a franchise-best start at 19-4 and matched the Lakers for the longest winning streak of the season. The two-time defending champion Lakers are 18-3. David Robinson had 11 points and a season-high 16 rebounds for the Spurs. Steve Smith added 14 points. "We played good consistent defense for 48 minutes, which is nice to see," Spurs coach Gregg Popovich said. "They allowed us opportunities and we took advantage. David (Robinson) set a great tone and Tim (Duncan) and Tony (Parker) created a lot of offense and the guys reacted to that well. It was a good night." Ruben Patterson led the Trail Blazers with 18 points. Rasheed Wallace had 15 points and 12 rebounds. Steve Kerr added 14 points -- 10 in the second quarter, two off his season high. "This season is long," Kerr said. "But playing in a former arena tends to juice you up a little bit." Kerr and Derek Anderson returned to San Antonio for the first since they were dealt to Portland for guard Steve Smith. Anderson, who forced the sign-and-trade deal, was booed by the crowd, while Kerr was cheered. "They usually don't act like that," Anderson said. "I guess maybe they've been drinking a little bit tonight. Not everybody was doing it, but some people you should expect that from." San Antonio, the NBA's best shooting 3-point team at 42.9 percent, was 9-of-22 from long range. The Spurs opened the third quarter with a 10-3 run and took a 22-point lead on Bruce Bowen's 3-pointer. The Blazers cut it to 84-73 on Kerr's two free throws early in the fourth quarter, but that was as close as the Blazers would get. "Defensively, I think we are playing pretty well," Duncan said. "There are stretches in the games where we go to sleep for a little while and let people back in the game. So there's a lot of improvement to be made." Portland scored a season-low 35 points in the first half, shooting 13-of-40 (33 percent) from the field. "We had a drought and that put us in a hole," Blazers coach Maurice Cheeks said. "I'm not really disappointed in the loss, but we were down 22 at one point and we came back. We've got to learn how to get our defense up to pare when we're not scoring."

Game notes
Duncan recorded his league-leading 20th double-doubles in the first 23 games of the season. ... The Spurs are 12-1 at home this season. ... Portland leads the series with San Antonio 58-49. ... The Spurs signed Jason Hart from the National Basketball Development League. The 23-year-old guard was drafted by Milwaukee in 2000.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: fieldGoals
statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.
